name: CTN-ITP-015 - Rejuvenation Treatment of Existing Pavement
template name: CTN-ITP-015 - Rejuvenation Treatment of Existing Pavement

name: Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
Reference Documents - Drawings and drawing registers
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
The Contractor shall carry out a prelim inary trial of the proposed rejuvenation operation. The trial shall determine the:
(b) number of passes of the stabilisation machine necessary to achieve uniform pulverisation and mixing;
(c) field moisture content required to achieve the specified compaction requirements;
(d) rolling routine required to meet the specified compaction requirements;
(e) uniformity of mixing six random test holes.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.3 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP`
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - A purpose built mixing machine designed for in-situ stabilisation of roadworks shall be used to pulverise the existing pavement material and uniformly. Rotary hoes and other types of agricultural machinery shall not be used.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to base rejuvenation, the existing pavement is to be inspected for existing asphalt patches greater than 1m2, which are to be removed prior to stablisation / blending.
• Where asphalt patches are removed, the existing subbase is to be inspected and subject to a test roll in accordance with DSG specification Section 173.03.
• If the exposed subbase comprises of unsuitable material, or fails the test roll, then the subbase is subject to a 200mm deep granular patch using class 3 crushed rock (or better).
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Water is to be introduced into the pavement via the attachment on the reclaimer after the first pass. The trial section used 200L/min at a speed of 12m/min to achieve satisfactory moisture content and compaction.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Base rejuvenation is to consist of the insitu stabilisation/blending of the top 150mm of existing pavement, including the pulverisation and incorporation of the existing seal.
• No cementitious binders or additives are to be incorporated.
• After stabilisation/ blending has been completed, the material is to be inspected for oversized material (>40mm) or chunks of the existing seal which have not been adequately pulverised.
• Oversize material and chunks of unpulverised seal are to be removed or reprocessed as necessary.
Inspection / Test Method - Visual and Measure
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - All pavement courses shall, after compaction, be finished to smooth and uniform surfaces, free of segregated areas, and conform ing to the limits for level, line, grade, thickness and cross section shown on the drawings or as specified.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - The surface of any compacted pavement layer or prepared subgrade shall be maintained in such a way as to minimise dust, prevent ravelling, erosion, deformation or any other damage to the layer resulting from environmental conditions, traffic or construction activities.
• The layer shall be kept free from contamination until any subsequent pavement work under the Contract is commenced or the Superintendent accepts and takes responsibility for that part of the Works.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
3.1 - Determine Testing Scale & Initial testing frequency

Acceptance Criteria - Initially test every lot until 3 consecutive lots of like material and/or work have achieved the standards specified in Clauses 304.08. and 304.10.  If no failures, Reduced Frequency applies as specified in Table 304.111.
Inspection / Test Method - Document Review/ Site Inspection
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
• All pavement layers shall be compacted to withstand rolling and shall be test rolled in accordance with Section 173, prior to acceptance of the layer.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Every Lot, Every second lot (reduced frequency)

Acceptance Criteria - The calculation of density ratio shall be based on tests performed using Modified compactive effort. The work shall be completed in accordance with Scale A requirements for testing of the upper subbase layer (98% Modified). Minimum testing for compaction is to be completed once every two lots.
Compaction Scale || Lower Subbase Layers || Upper Subbase Layers || Base Layers: Layer directly beneath the Bituminous Surfacing || Base Layers: Other Layers
A || Not less than 98.0 || Not less than 98.0 || Not less than 100.0 || Not less than 99.0
B || Not less than 97.0 || Not less than 97.0 || Not less than 98.0 || Not less than 98.0
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Refer to table 304.111 for various minimum frequency or testing for Grading and PL

Acceptance Criteria - If specified in Clause 304.10(c) or Clause 304.10(d), following completion of compaction, material shall be tested for post-compaction grading or Plasticity Index (PI) at the frequency specified in Clause 304.11 for the appropriate Scale of Testing specified in Clause 304.12(a).
• Pavement Rejuvenation shall have a PI between 0-10, tested once evey 4 lots.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Layer to be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and after compaction shall have no point deviation > 8mm from 3m straight edge. The subbase shall also not be less than the specified thickness by more than 15mm
Reference Documents - 304.06(b, d, i) Drawings Table 304.062
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - The regulation layer is to comprise of Class 1 crushed rock for a minimum thickness of 100mm. Where the base rejuvenation layer is within 100mm of FSL after the mechanical blending / stabilisation has been completed, the rejuvenation layer is to be trimmed to FSL -100 to accomodate the minimum thickness regulation layer.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

Roadway || Road Chainage / Location || Scale of Surface Level Measurement (A, B or C) || Scale for Assessment of Compaction (A, B, or C) || Scale for Assessment of Post-Compaction Grading and PI (A, B or C)
Midland Highway || Within Limits of Works || A || A || A
Glen Esk Rd || Within Limits of Works || B || B || B
Woorak Rd || Within Limits of Works || B || B || B
Access Roads || Within Limits of Works || C || Not applicable || C
Where for any location a specific scale has not been nominated, Scale A shall apply.
